title: Principal Systems Engineer - Cloud Infrastructure
content:
Job Summary
The Principal System Engineer will lead project teams for large IT infrastructure initiatives. This role will establish direction and help implement technologies for new and existing systems architectures. In addition, this position will work directly with the Architects for the design of functional solutions and be accountable for road mapping and the delivery of the solution. This position will lead planned monthly IT maintenance events and will also mentor and coach team members.
Duties & Responsibilities
Bring deep knowledge and experience to IT infrastructure projects
Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices using tools such as Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, Terraform, or similar technologies to enable consistent and repeatable infrastructure deployments.
Drive automation initiatives to streamline provisioning, configuration management, monitoring, and scaling of Azure resources and services.
Contribute to ongoing CI/CD automation process improvement reviews using Key Performance Indicator (KPI) metrics to eliminate errors, maximize hardware/software efficiencies and increase service up-time
Develop, document and execute CI/CD automation processes involving CI/CD pipelines on Azure cloud platforms,  infrastructure as code, end-to-end automation across layers of cloud-based network functions.
Participate on project teams for large IT infrastructure initiatives and periodically take on a project lead role
Define and update documentation for new and existing application and systems architectures
Define and perform lifecycle maintenance plans for production software and related equipment
Act as technical escalation point for complex support issues
Lead planned monthly IT maintenance events (ex, system patching)
Write business correspondence for recommendations, project support, and customer service purposes
Work with Project Managers to develop project scopes, estimates, milestones, and timelines
Implement and maintain computer systems to meet the organization’s current and future requirements
Provide daily administration and oversight of enterprise server, virtualization, and storage systems
Proactively identify, analyze, and resolve system problems and computer resource allocation
Serve as a subject matter expert and technical consultant on projects assigned
Maintain project plans and documentation of system and network builds and modifications
Research, identify, and evaluate new products and services within the IT field
Provide technical assistance and mentoring to technical team members to increase skill sets and understanding
Interact and coordinate with vendors, suppliers, distributors, and contract consultants
Have an excellent working knowledge of the current industry standard server operating systems and major productivity suite applications
Responsible for development and documentation of corporate policies and procedures as related to system and network use
Stay aware of emerging and evolving technologies to assist in setting strategic direction of the core service offerings for the organization
Work with the team to identify and implement the most optimal cloud-based solutions for the company
Manage cloud environments in accordance with company security guidelines
Work directly with the Architects for the design of functional solutions and be accountable for road mapping and the delivery of the solution
Mentor and coach others and provide input on performance evaluations
Ownership over the delivery of multiple, complex business facing technologies (ecosystem) to deliver business outcomes
Significant, senior-level interactions with key clients and stakeholders
Provide technical subject matter expertise on multiple, concurrent complex projects
Strategize with business and technology stakeholders to define future-state business capabilities & requirements, and translate into transitional and target state architectures
Provide support to management on build vs buy decisions
Experience & Education Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree (preferred emphasis in Computer Science or MIS) or equivalent experiences
10+ years of experience in System, Virtualization, and Storage Engineering
Experience with SOA applications and cloud-based services, preferably AWS or Azure
Thorough knowledge on Active Directory Administration and Management
Expertise using PowerShell to manage Servers, infrastructure, and applications
Expertise with scripting and programming
Expertise in designing, configuring, and management of hyper converged infrastructure (HCI) and converged environments
Solid technical background in server support on a Microsoft Windows network
Solid technical background in network support with switches, routers, firewalls, and application delivery controllers
Cloud Certification, and/or OpenStack Administrator Certification
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as ARM templates, Terraform, or similar technologies.
Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Ansible, Terraform, PowerShell, Python) for automating cloud-related tasks
Expertise in designing and managing all aspects of Microsoft Active Directory
Knowledge of ITIL and Industry best practices
Disaster Recovery and BCP experience
Experience in distributed data center model
Experience with automated monitoring tools
Experience with collaboration software
Preferred Requirements
Experience working within an IT organization in the financial services industry
Skills & Abilities
Strong organizational, communication, and time management skills
Interpersonal and presentation skills for interacting with team members and business units
Analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills
Ability to work in a team environment as well as develop and mentor employees
Strong technical documentation ability
#LI-Remote #LI-MB1Additional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
1Top Workplaces USA 2022 – 2023 
2Des Moines Register Top Workplaces 2018 – 2022
